website_summaries.verdict: The Fitbit Charge is a fine replacement for the discontinued Fitbit Force, but you're better off waiting for Fitbit's heart-rate-tracking upgrade.
pros: The Fitbit Charge has a comfortable design and a display for time and step-tracking
It gets call notifications and syncs automatically to a variety of phone platforms
cons: The forthcoming Charge HR adds heart-rate tracking and a better clasp for just $20 more
the Fitbit app is well designed but feels a little dated compared to the competition

customer_reviews.title: Getting more fit bit by bit
customer_reviews.text: I love having a Fitbit! It's very motivating, and great to see your steps, floors climbed, and miles each day. The web site is fun, too, since it breaks down your most (and least) active times of day, days in each week. Some family members have the version that clips on your belt or pocket, but the wrist band is so much more convenient. The Fitbit Customer Service has been great for me, and I'm picky. I lost one as the wrist band seemed loose and it just fell off without me realizing it until much later in the day. They replaced it, free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: MMS

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I like this Fitbit better than the Flex that I previously had, primarily because the band is so much easier to put on. The battery needs to be recharged every two or three days (the Flex lasted about five). I use steps, fluid and sleep tracking. Stair tracking doesn't appear to be very accurate; I know that up and down count as one, but it doesn't count them all. I've read that the band breaks frequently, so I'm careful with it when I recharge it. Sometimes naps don't record as sleep; adding them isn't very accurate (maybe I'm doing it wrong - shows lots of wake/restless time instead of manually set start and stop times).
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Amazing company
customer_reviews.text: I will say that I purchased this for my girlfriend for a Christmas present back in December and she has worn it everyday, she loves it. However, it gets 1 star because in less than a years time it has started to fall apart! First the band began to separate from the unit, then this morning the part that covers the charge port fell off, pretty disappointing. I will be in touch with the manufacturer for sure. Update- Fitbit is absolutely amazing and once I got in touch with them they were more than happy to help and replace the defective product! I would be glad to do business with this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Switched from the Fitbit Flex
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the Fitbit Flex and it just broke one day (I'll tell that story at a later date). Actually, the same thing happened to my mom, too. We both decided to switch to the Fitbit Force. This was one of the best choices of my life. Mostly. Here is my comparison with the Flex. PROS -Display can see the exact amount and the time. -Caller ID when connected to the phone. -Very similar locking system as the Flex. Very durable. -Completely waterproof, too. -Still gives you sleeping ability. -A lot thinner. CONS -Force has very short battery. Also, it requires a weird position to charge the unit. -A little bigger on your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Leopold

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit for an active person....
customer_reviews.text: I tried this item out for several weeks and I am pretty disappointed. Mine was in no way accurate in relation to the number of steps that I took. As a matter of fact, it actually logged me as walking while I was driving on a trip. In regard to tracking for health related reasons, I feel that with its inconsistency regarding steps, flights of stairs, etc. a person needs to know their heart rate to determine accurate calorie loss. Therefore, I feel the HR might have been the way to go. Also. The way out fastens makes it very easy to catch and have fall off. An actual buckle would be much safer.
customer_reviews.author: DMFasig

customer_reviews.title: FITBITB CHARGE WIRELESS
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY SECOND FITBIT, PURCHASED BECAUSE I THOUGHT I LOST THE FIRST ONE. ON THIS FITBIT, I FIND THE SIDE KNOB, WE PRESS TO SEE RESULTS ,IS TOO RECESSED.. SO I PRESS TOO HARD AND IT SKIPS PASS ONE OR TWO READ OUTS,. IT WORKS FINE TO TELL TIME, STEPS, CALORIES, ETC. SLEEP TIMES SEEM SHORT FROM WHAT I FEEL I SLEEP. ALL IN ALL I LIKE IT FINE. MARIE C 6/4 2016 THIS IS AN ADD ONTO MY ORIGINAL REVIEW.ABOVE. THIS FITBIT IS NOT KEEPING A CHARGE.. I LEFT IT CHARGING OVERNIGHT, NOW JUST 8 HOURS LATER IT NEEDS A CHARGE. TOO LATE TO RETURN/EXCHANGE. BY A WEEK. SO I AM STUCK WITH IT. MARIE C.
customer_reviews.author: Marie C.

customer_reviews.title: Really great fitness device
customer_reviews.text: Syncs up with RedBrickHealth to get health activity rewards through my employer. I love this partnership between cloud businesses. Very comfortable to wear. All functions work with CyanogenMod / Android 5.1.1 on a Sony Z3 Compact. Caller ID has a slight delay to buzz, but still soon enough to answer without problems. Connectivity is good; syncs fast. Easier to activate with mobile device vs PC. Even firmware updates can upload to the Charge over Bluetooth! Another note: if you can get all your Fitbit interaction done with mobile and Web; you'll never really need to install the wireless USB dongle. Charges perfectly with supplied cable and any 1.5A wall charger.
customer_reviews.author: mose

customer_reviews.title: Great for just about everything
customer_reviews.text: I used my Fitbit religiously until I ended up with an Apple Watch. The fitbit is great for tracking just about everything; the one thing the Charge doesn't do is heart rate, and I've read several reviews that the Charge HR isn't particularly accurate over a certain bpm. Two major things the Fitbit Charge has over the Apple Watch is the battery life (lasts about a week) and sleep tracking. I didn't use the Fitbit app to track my workouts as I have a separate place to do that. Overall, I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to track their daily movement and sleep analysis.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: I like this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I like numbers so there's nothing like getting credit for walking around. It's helpful to be reminded that I need to move (what?! only 5,468 steps today? I need to go for a walk). Only two minuses that I have found: In a jiggly mini-bus on a rough road, it thinks I'm walking and the step counter is inflated; and yes, the band is easily unlatched, as others have complained. The latter is not terribly annoying, however, as I have only had it come off once or twice in the past month or so since I've been wearing it. Overall, I'm very pleased with my Fitbit Charge.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Williams

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful piece of (S$#%) garbage
customer_reviews.text: What a waste. Love the tracker. But the band is falling apart. And the only remedy - DESPITE BEING UNDER WARRANTY - is a replacement in a size that's unwearable (extra large) and a color that's undesirable (purple) because that's all they have left. They sold a faulty product (check the overwhelming number of bands falling apart in any fitbit comment section), couldn't find a way to fix it, and decided to stiff those who bought it. FITBIT IS A FAILURE -- FIND ANOTHER TRACKER. Addendum: Squeaky wheel and all that. Complained loud enough (and quoted this review) and am now getting a new Alta to replace the damaged Charge at no 'charge'. Thank you fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: AuntTerry

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable Enough
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in January 2016. Within a month, the metal clasp on the band broke. I called FitBit and they replaced it right away. Now, with 10 months on the replacement, the replacement stopped syncing. I contacted FitBit and they informed me that since they provided one warranty replacement already, they will not provide any warranty support for the syncing issue even though it has been less than the 1 year warranty period measured from the original purchase date. In short, this product did not meet my expectations; I don't feel it is durable enough. It didn't even last one year.
customer_reviews.author: M Noraa

customer_reviews.title: Meh, I'm returning mine after a week of unimpressiveness
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like this and put up with it's quirks. It worked it seemed, tracking sleep and walking.. the computer interface is cool... but my Charge just kept deciding to take naps and not track me. Though I followed instructions... kept it charged correctly, never got it wet, etc... it tracked my sleep some nights but not others. It would just shut off, unknown to me. After the third time of it not waking and me plugging it into the computer to wake it up.. and finding.. oh yeah... no data to sync last 12 hrs.. I'm done. Not worth the hassle. Great idea though. The website part is nice.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mardis

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as part of a fitness challenge at work, it as a great motivator. The app was great and although the motion detector on this Fitbit is sensitive (even when adjusting for dominate arm even though worn on non-dominate arm). I live on a small ranch and logged a LOT of steps driving our ATV across the pasture. My reason for only 2 stars is because after about two months the battery charge started to shorten. By the time I'd used the Fitbit for 3 months it would no longer hold a charge for 24 hours. It's been tossed aside and I changed to a product with a 7 month battery- no charging.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Breaks too easily but Fitbit replaced it
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and broke within a year. the redeeming quality is that they sent me a brand new one, no questions asked. BUT, with this new one, the little side button that allows you to scroll through steps, miles, calories, broke again right away and the rubber casing is starting to pull apart. I do not sweat much with it on, but I wear it 24/7 except in shower. I imagine this one will go about another year and it will fall apart. The apps are good as are the challenges etc developed by Fitbit. But a better product would have made this great, or rated 4 -5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Has been replaced 3 times within 1 year of purchase. Fitbit even upgraded my replacement to a Fitbit Charge HR which has malfunctioned also. Fitbit is telling me since I am out of the warranty period I can have 25% off a new purchase. Who in their right mind would spend over $100 each year for a tracker. The trackers also did not sync which required constant contact with the manufacturer to reboot the tracker for it to work. Fitbit has since stopped selling both trackers, and I can see 100% why.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I was really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I spent a $100 bucks for a watch that would count my knitting as steps or if I hit bumps in the car as steps. There was a system update about 2 months in and it killed my counter. I got a replacement that died the same way and Fitbit discontinued it and wouldn't send me another or credit this toward a better model and I would pay the difference. Now I have a Fossil Hybrid that totally kicks ass and is much more stylish.
customer_reviews.author: always lookin' for music

customer_reviews.title: Only bad thing about this product is the design
customer_reviews.text: Only bad thing about this product is the design, the rubber peeled off and it broke only after 5 months, I wore all the time except when in water/shower, However, their customer service was prompt and excellent and they send me a new one free of charge after I confirmed my purchase. I really love using this tracker and it keeps accurate track of my activity and sleep, but I just wish it was designed better. Also, NOTE: purchase those rubber things that hold it together, because IT WILL come off when you least expect it, I almost lost it on the bus twice before I bought those little things.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this purchase--quality issues abound
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present. From the time I purchased it until the Fitbit one-year warranty was up I replaced this device five times. Wristband unraveled, buttons fell off, eyelets popped out. I am very careful with my items--no water damage or rough handling. The Fitbit Customer Support was very courteous and cooperative and the unit was replaced each time with little hassle (I was asked to provide pictures of the problem after the second replacement). Even so, I find the quality of the units I received to be less than I expected and will not purchase from Fitbit again. P.S. Daughter also received the Fitbit Charge HR--same kinds of problems.
customer_reviews.author: Caduceus26

customer_reviews.title: A game changer
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit in general has changed my life by allowing true fitness to be set and attained. The charge is comfortable and easy to read with great battery life. Unfortinately I had some reliability issues. I know several people who have a Charge with no problem but I had fits. Two were replaced under warranty and I upgraded to an Alta with the third. Customer service was amazing and i haven’t had a problem since. Fitbit software is great and sync’s with my phone and our corporate wellness software.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Alan

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago at Christmas. I have been meaning to write a review. I'm glad I waited. First I would like to say my wife loves it, and it has actually helped her lose 55 pounds!! Well after wearing it 24-7 for a year, the band broke where you connect it. This was a good thing. She called them and told them, and they sent her the newest model, ABSOLUTELY FREE. They stand behind their product, and that means something. Highly recommend. Shipping was on time.
customer_reviews.author: Kosar 19

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for 6 months and it will not charge. The charger cord continuously falls out of the back of the Fitbit, so no matter where I charge it, if you bump it the least little bit, it falls off. It sure seems to me like there should be a better connection. After 5 months it began to get an exclamation point when I tried to charge it. Sometimes after a while it will spontaneously begin to charge. It isn't much good to keep me moving if I am sitting at the computer trying to charge it for hours each week. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher 1st/2nd Split

customer_reviews.title: Great way to keep her exercising
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my aunt. Great way to keep her exercising. She loves the counter...& software. I use a garmin but she does not run marathons etc. It has really helped her stay motivated. Sometimes the software has done funny things while looking at data or downloading, and that is the only reason to not have full five stars!
customer_reviews.author: A. Boileau

customer_reviews.title: Thanks, but no thanks
customer_reviews.text: Bitterly disappointed at the apparent low quality of the Charge compared to its predecessors. I have owned the Force and the Flex, and both had higher build quality than the cheaply made Charge. Also the "silent alarm" on the Charge isn't silent at all. Rather than vibrating the device, and therefore your wrist, it just buzzes loudly with little sensation of actually vibrating. I've had the Charge in my possession exactly an hour, and I've gone back to my Force already. It's a shame, because I've been a happy customer of Fitbit since 2012,but this really isn't a good product in my opinion. Thanks Fitbit, but no thanks. Maybe I'll get the Apple Watch or something else instead.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Better than Flex!  LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been through two flexes...troubles with syncing...battery issues, and I've had my Charge since waaaay before he got into the Fitbit thing. I love that my Charge gives me info about my steps and mileage right on the screen, without having to sync. Can't say enough good things about it. I do know folks have had issues with the clasp failing, but you can buy little bands to go around the clasp to secure it. I did try a Surge, but sent it back. The screen is too hard to read (I'm sure they are trying to save the battery life)...I had wanted GPS tracking for hikes, but I just use Map My Hike instead. BUY A CHARGE.
customer_reviews.author: Janice McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Well this thing was a bust. It arrived without a "dongle" (the plug to connect to a computer) which I figured was fine since I was using my smart phone anyway. In the week I had it it never seemed to get anything right - steps, sleep, stairs, etc. In the last two days it started falling off my wrist every few hours (for no apparent reason other than it does not have a normal secure clasp - in uses prongs that just fit into holes). And today it fell off pot a last time without my noticing. Gone. I only had it for a week but it proved to be useless to the end.
customer_reviews.author: eebees

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. It's my first attempt at a fitness tracker and it's OK. The band is difficult; lining up those little hooks and slots on the soft flesh of one's wrist is not a snap. I had to call customer service to set up my app. TURN OFF BLUETOOTH before installing the app (doesn't tell you that); then open Bluetooth during installation. But I guess it does what it's supposed to do once I can get the thing on my wrist. Oh and the charging cord...it's like 5 inches long. How the heck do I charge the thing? Dangling from the wall? Dangling from the computer (USBs are in the side of the monitor). What's up with that?
customer_reviews.author: Zee Cubed

customer_reviews.title: Great product and motivator!
customer_reviews.text: This product has been amazing! I am very aware now how much water I drink now, calories I consume, steps I take and even how much quality sleep I'm getting. I like that it is comfortable, sleek and stylish to wear.i also like how it will notify you when you've reached 10,000 steps. It's such a motivator and constant reminder for me that I find myself wanting to eat better, exercise, walk more etc. because the Fitbit keeps me accountable all day. Even if you are pretty disciplined already, this is a great product and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mariel Falk

customer_reviews.title: We love Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: This was my wife's first wrist worn Fitbit. She loved it but while hiking the mountains it came loose somewhere and fell off. I called Fitbit explained what had happened, they apologized and sent another right away. WELL, the one they sent had battery issues, explaining my problem 1st over the phone and then back and forth through email, with them offering suggestions to improve battery life they agreed it needed replaced. Only problem, this one was no longer available, so they are sending a newer model. Love Fitbit, as a product and their customer service
customer_reviews.author: Dale Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware the Bands for the Fitbit Charges are a Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Fitbit for my daughter's Birthday in January of this Year, and 2 weeks ago the band came apart and there are no replacement bands, and since I bought it through Amazon I can't have it replaced without buying a new one, what a pure piece of junk and I love Fitbit but this model is worthless and I'm seeing I'm not the only one with this problem, is it because they are being sold through Amazon and we get the "Defected" Fitbits!?! Not a Happy shopper
customer_reviews.author: DivaD

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Charge does not hold a charge, ironically
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this such a low rating because of Fitbit's misleading claims about the Charge's, well, charge. it claims that the Charge will keep its charge 10-12 days. But out of the box, I got only 3 days charge and since then it has got only worse. Now less than 3 months later, it won't keep a charge longer than 12 hours and that's with all notifications and features turned off except for the daily target notification, which can't be turned off. There's also no call support number, just FAQs, which suggests to me that they know they are selling a lot of defective units. Will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Inigo Montoya

customer_reviews.title: I realy enjoy this piece of machinery 😆 i like its size
customer_reviews.text: I realy enjoy this piece of machinery 😆 i like its size, its very light. Comes in two sizes. Love the fact that it has the time on it. Had the Flex before which only showed a step count, this is way better and not crazy expebsive. Only issue I have with the Fitbit is that eventualy the rubber and clasp that holds it close become a bit loose (I lost my previous fitbit Flex that way, it just unbuckled and fell off at some point). My current is 6 months and its starting to unclasp. The additional free phone app makes this a great way to challenge and interact with friends. Great motivation to get moving!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Bakowska

customer_reviews.title: Great idea poorly quality
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for just a little over a year now. The battery sucks. We had to charge it every after six months. For the price youd think id last much longer. Heck we even had it only syncing only when we tell it to to try and save battery life. Dont waste your money. I have a charge HR and its the same plus the charging cable has a hard time staying on the unit. I have a friend that talked me into these and him and his wife have the same problem too.
customer_reviews.author: Meng

customer_reviews.title: Great product, FitBit customer service is AMAZING.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife and she is on the third one in 6 months. The first one simply died after about 6 weeks. It would not come on, charge, or sync. One quick call to FitBit and they shipped a new one. About 4 months later, the new one lost the single side button, so she could not use the functions. Again, a call to FitBit and they quickly replaced it. She loves it, and despite having had to get it replaced twice, it is awesome when it is working. Would give it six stars if it were not for the replacements. Would have given it one star if FitBit was not so amazing about standing behind the product.
customer_reviews.author: DTJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 6 months of casual wear, then fell apart in three places. The band fell off where it was glued to the display, the plastic cover of the display fell off and the plastic button fell out. Cheap piece of crap. Updated: Fitbit customer service was very responsive and replaced the item, although they said they didn't have the original size or color in stock and I'd have to settle for a blue large, rather than a small black. But at least they responded to my emails, which is something so I added a star.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but sadly fragile
customer_reviews.text: I love my FitBit Charge. Sadly I have had 2 break on me in regular use. The first the button popped off and Fit Bit replaced it for me. Then the second wristband broke a short time later and needs completely replaced :( It breaks my heart because it was a great way to keep track of my activity and improve my healthiness despite Sjogrens, fibromyalgia and inflammatory myopathy...but this mama can't afford another dime to. Replace it :(
customer_reviews.author: TWiley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in February of 2016 and once I had it I loved it. I love the programs it offers and how it it is to keep track. The biggest disappointment is the battery. After a few months it would only stay charge for about 2 days I did all the things that was suggested for battery life and it just got worse. Now the battery last about 4 hours and its dead. This is why I am giving it 2 stars. I have heard great things of this product and I don't know if I just got a defective product, but I am extremely disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Becareful how you ware this.
customer_reviews.text: To be totally honest, I expected more and was let down. I actually had to order two, because the first one went bad. It fogged up on the inside when I wore it while working out. It was not tight around my wrist, it was loose. No I did not go swimming with it either. My second worked just fine, it did not do the same as the first. I still use it today.
customer_reviews.author: Randal S. Richter II

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the poor band design
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a reward for my first 5k. Six months later, it's still working (and I'm training for a 1/2 marathon) but the band is falling apart. I wear it daily, but isn't that the point of a fitness tracker? Very disappointed in the poor band design. Other than that, love the app, features, once I accidentally went into a lake with it and it didn't skip a beat despite not being waterproof. Love the feature of moving my hand up and it shows the time, that it buzzes when my phone rings -- all good. but that BAND, total stinker.
customer_reviews.author: BHS

customer_reviews.title: Used it for 3 months and thought that we loved it. At three months
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 3 months and thought that we loved it. At three months, it stopped working. Spent 5 hours on the phone with Fitbit Customer Support and ended up doing a factory reset. It started to work again and I used it for about a month. Then it snapped in half! We used it for normal, every day activity. It didn't last long. :( We ended up going out and buying two iWatches instead. I would not recommend this product. Not reliable and quality is inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery Lasts LESS than 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it TWO MONTHS ago, a charge lasted two days. Now it lasts less than 24 hours (generally about 18 -20 hours). I have run the updates recommended on line and turned off all of the syncing thing recommended to extend battery life. I am reaching back to the seller to request a new one. When it is working I love it. The mobile app has a tendency to stop recording a hike shortly after I start. I get to the end of a 4 mile hike and it tells me I walked to the end of the parking lot at the trail head and stopped. That is an issue with the App not the fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Worst battery life
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with saying I love how my Fitbit works and tracks my steps. It's very motivating and it does what I wanted it to do. HOWEVER. The battery life is absolutely horrendous. It doesn't even last two days and I've had it for maybe two weeks. I turned off my Bluetooth and all day sync and it hasn't made the slightest bit of difference. I don't know if mine is defective or not, because it's supposed to last 7 days, but it is very frustrating when it dies with no warning after a day and a half of use.
customer_reviews.author: bri

customer_reviews.title: She was happy with it and used it all the time
customer_reviews.text: My daughter saved her own money to buy her very own Fitbit. She was happy with it and used it all the time. After a few months she began having difficulty with the band and a few days later the whole Fitbit fell off and was lost. She was very disappointed. It was a lot of money for an 11-year old to save and then to lose it was a shame. I understand this was a problem with some of the Fitbit models and that they were replaced by the company. I am wondering if this is one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Garrod

customer_reviews.title: I like that it alerts me to calls coming in on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to my original review. Accuracy of steps is questionable as mine seems to fail to record some steps and my husband's Fitbit records even his gestures. I like that it alerts me to calls coming in on my cell and numerous options for tracking, although the accuracy is questionable. I originally thought that, even with its slight inaccuracy, it was a great fitness aid. However, after less than 6 months, the band is failing, the back has come off and won't stay on, and it went "bonkers" (vibrating wildly when I tried to recharge it) today and finally quit. I'm about to request a refund. We'll see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Great for four months
customer_reviews.text: The concept was great and it worked fine for about four months then a week ago it went from holding a charge for around 5 days to not even lasting a full day. I'm having to charge it daily now and it isn't even lasting all day. The other issue with this model is that it has these two little prongs that snap into the band to supposedly secure it. I have lost it multiple times because it easily falls of my wrist but fortunately found it every time.
customer_reviews.author: LiveLifeVideo

customer_reviews.title: I got 2 lemons.....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Fitbit...it would not charge nor would it sinc....i opted to return it and replace it with a new fitbit..the second fitbit arrived the next day and had the SAME PROBLEMS!!!! i will return fit it #2, go to a store locally so i can get a reliable tracker...i had a fitbit a few years ago and loved it...i am used it until it broke...i funally purchased a new one and have to wait to go through this foolishness....again, dont waste your time like i did...go to a store to make a reliable purchase....
customer_reviews.author: Heather M. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 7.5 months.
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of daily use, cover started falling off. After 6 months, I could barely plug it into the charger. After 7.5 months of daily use, it completely fall apart. Never got it wet, just appeared to have shoddy construction. Also, the charge never lasted more than a couple of days. I checked the time several times an hour, because I used it as a watch, so maybe if you never touched it, the charge would last a week as advertised. Gave it 2.5 stars, instead of 1, because it did work as intended for the short time I had it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Very happy consumer
customer_reviews.text: Love this! The sleep patterns and walking distances are surprisingly accurate. I backpacked 12 miles and the Fitbit very accurately estimated the distance. This watch also gives you choices in the watch display and you can sync it to your phone, which is a really cool feature. I just keep my phone on silent now and rely on my Fitbit, it's much less disturbing. You can also set silent alarms, which do actually wake you up, in a much more subtle way than alarm clocks. The only disadvantage is that it's not water proof and only measures arm movement. Bike riding, for example, cannot be evaluated accurately. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Great for motivation, fantastic customer service.
customer_reviews.text: **Update** stopped working after 3 months. Contacted Amazon regarding the warrantee. They directed me to fitbit. Contacted Fitbit by phone. They helped me with with trouble shooting and after a few minutes they said it was defective. They got my information and a copy of the Amazon purchase receipt. Then shipped a new one right out. Very fast and polite. Upset that it quit after 2 months, but I'm really impressed with the customer service. My wife loves it and wear's it all the time. It's not big bulky or in the way. Really helps keeping her motivated. The silent alarm on it doesn't wake her up, but occasionally it does wake me up.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and I really like this Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service and I really like this Fitbit; it has a great warranty. I gave it 2 stars because it has a great warranty. It worked great for a bout two months then I was having trouble with the battery not lasting and trouble syncing to my phone. Fitbit has good troubleshooting and support. They could tell my battery life was not good. They sent me a replacement in May. Again worked great for a couple of months. Now it is not syncing to my phone or computer and the battery last about 3 days. I contacted Fitbit again and they are sending me the new Alta for no charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's cool!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was ready to send it back because I couldn't figure out why it wouldn't sync, apparently I wasn't syncing it in I-Tunes. This is day two, and already I have received badges and phone calls. I am a professional house-cleaner, and the Fit-bit vibrates when a call comes through. l will never miss a call when vacuuming! I also love the sleep function- after one night I was amazed on how many times I was restless throughout the night. I also love the fact when you move your arm, it lights up to show time and date ( I chose the date plus time feature). We will see how it holds out- so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: PJS

customer_reviews.title: Love my FItbit but defective
customer_reviews.text: This Fitbit is very motivating. Not only tracks mileage but sleep, stairs climbed and has an alarm that wakes me every morning. Update Within 6 months started unraveling although I never wore in water and carefully treated like a watch. I contacted Fitbit and they immediately sent a replacement. I noticed immediately the replacement did not hold a charge up to 8 days but only up to 5. Then after a few months I had to charge every 3 days and sometimes 2 days...ridiculous. so now I will contact them again. Unfortunately warranty is only a year. Some of my friends also had issues and switched to another product.
customer_reviews.author: Toya 92

customer_reviews.title: SEVERE WRIST PAIN.
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this item. I am 24 years old and have had this product for 3 days. I've worn it for each day on the loosest setting, and have experienced shooting pain down my arm into my fingertips. Returning it now. For something that is meant to be bettering my health, it's doing a great job of risking it. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Marie-Therese Hernon

customer_reviews.title: Is alright
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good but the closure part needs to be fixed and adapted better. The count for calories burned also is confusing and I believe is not accurate at all. Walking 2000 steps (which is very minimal) does not burn 1000 calories. But all in all the design is nice and so is the watch and step counter. You do not have to pay for a fee after the original price. I bought it when it was on sale but I wouldn't pay anymore than $100 because it is essentially a glorified step counter.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Bukowski

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts about 1.5 year max
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for just over a year when the band started falling apart and the battery started dying after 24 hours or so. Contacted FitBit support and was offered 25% off a new Fitbit, no option to repair. Disappointed. Fitbits have a very short shelf life and no recourse beyond the 1 year warranty period. I will be trying another tracker next time, pretty disappointed in the (lack of) support I received. Beware of Fitbit products unless you like buying a new one every 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: someday

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I really like my Fitbit Charge. I didn't think I would care about the caller id feature, but it has come in handy many times when my phone isn't in reach or I'm working. The only issue I have with it is that it counts steps when I'm not moving. I'm a hairstylist, so I am on my feet all day, but I move my arms a lot. So there are times that I'm sitting down or standing and just moving my hands and it buzzes and tells me I've hit my 10,000 steps. So I don't think it is super accurate, however, it gets my butt off the couch and out walking every single day.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Charge model for my husband for the sleep feature. He believes this caused tennis elbow after a few months. Not sure he’s too off base. He’s been body building for 40 years and has never had any problems with hos elbows before or since he stopped wearing it. And it only occurred on the arm that he wore the fitbit. For this reason I stopped wearing mine.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Hate it
customer_reviews.text: I love this product!!! Not the typical start to a 1 star review. I love the Fitbit, but do not buy this product. The band will fall off this product and is not replaceable. My first one fell apart about 10 months after I bought it. Fitbit happily replaced it for me with a new product!!!! Awesome, problem is that the replacement product which is now 4-5 months old is having the same problem, band is falling off. No problem chat with Fitbit again.......sorry your product is no longer under warranty. Pay the extra money and go with the Alta or Blaze, do not buy the Fitbit with non-replaceable bands. They just don't last.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tas

customer_reviews.title: "Step Count" is NOT Feet Walked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spur me on to regular fitness pursuits. It's good for that but I have one suggestion. Rename the "10,000" steps tracker feature. It's a misnomer! You can be sitting folding laundry or typing on your computer and as your hand/wrist moves, it counts "steps" for you. You can be fooled into believing you have actually moved that many steps in your day, but to what value?? It's misleading. People seriously wanting to know that daily number are best directed to the miles walked which are far fewer than a 10,000 "step" count implies.
customer_reviews.author: KayCee

customer_reviews.title: Worked a while, then fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mum around Christmas for her gift. She wore it fore about five months and didn't subject it to any harsh environments or use and it came apart in places it seemed like it should've been firmly put together. When I saw wiring exposed I contacted Amazon and they replaced the item. So my guess is as good as yours if you should buy it. My mum loves it though and doesn't do anything without having it on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Austyn

customer_reviews.title: At first i was very happy with the purchase but after several months the rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: At first i was very happy with the purchase but after several months the rubber came off in some places. I contacted seller and they sent me another one but same happened with that too. So i'm changing my review from 5 to 3 stars because I liked the customer service. Otherwise i dont recommend to use this product in high humidity areas.
customer_reviews.author: salomka

customer_reviews.title: Bands Broke 6 Months After Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I each bought one, and the bands aren't very durable. We both work very physical jobs. His band started peeling away from the top, and eventually broke in his sleep, and my band is already having trouble snapping because the interior of one of the holes is stripping away. The Fitbit technology is cool, and it's helped both of us stay on track with diet and exciting. But I can't recommend the Charge to people who work with their hands all day. I'd go with the Alta, because at least you can change the bands if they wear out or break.
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Charge vs. Peak, charge wins
customer_reviews.text: I had the Basis Peak. Great sleep information. Constant headaches with syncing, loss of server. I have used the Charge now for two weeks. The software is much slicker and sophisticated than Peak, EXCEPT for the sleep software. Improving my sleep was the primary reason I purchased an activity tracker. That remains my primary reason to use a tracker. The sleep tracker is rather elemental and does not provide information about REM or deep sleep. I like the length of charge, sleek non-clunky appearance. I really appreciate that I can adjust steps for my actual stride. I like the ability to track my eating habits and I have lost weight, since documenting my food consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this and keep track of my daily progress!! I ordered this in March of 2015. It's now December and the thing is falling apart!!! The plastic around the black screen has been coming unglued for the last 2 months. It's getting worse with each day I wear it. I have never been more disappointed with a product I got from Amazon than I have with this. It didn't even last me a year.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 fit bits, and each of my kids have one. This one was for my son. At first, it worked fine, but within a month it would not hold a charge even for a full day (it is supposed to last a week). Fitbit replaced it for free, but they didn't have blue anymore so he had to get black. Also, if it had been outside the warranty they would not have replaced it. The fitbit software on the phone seems to have problems syncing with 2 devices. it actually gets them mixed up and says one of them has activity when it's acutally the other.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C

customer_reviews.title: Great features, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fitbit app and all of the features. But I hate how cheaply this product is made. The face cracked with three months of having it, and I was not doing anything rigorous at the time. Then the band came loose and now will not faster back down tightly. If I bump my arm, the band pops off. When I'm taking it off, the band pops off. I was tempted to try the new Fitbit, but if the quality isn't any better, I'm sorry to say, I'm done with Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Denise S.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fitbit, and customer service is great!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS!! It works perfectly and has inspired me to exercise more. I've never had problems uploading my data or synching my Fitbit with my phone or computer. Once, the little button that lets you switch between what you see on the screen (time vs. steps vs. stairs, etc.) fell off, and Fitbit replaced the entire unit free of charge. (I had to send in a photo of how it was broken, and they sent me a new unit within days.) I like that I can set up challenges with other Fitbit users. It's a lot of fun and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Maria M.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for a healthier lifestyle.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure many people have said this changed their lives but it really accomplished that for me. I find myself, now that I know my daily walking-exercising patterns, realizing that some days I walk more than others. It's been two weeks now and I have had just one day that I missed the 10,000-step mark. I also really enjoyed learning about my sleep patterns. I found out that my husband who sleeps less than I do comes out about equal to me as I have a more restless sleep pattern. My only question is whether I can get a new type of band for my fitbit as I am not sure it works for more formal dress situations.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for calculating my wrist movements!
customer_reviews.text: Works well if you are not driving! This thing counts every movement of your hands, so I drive quite a bit for work and after reaching my 10,000 step goal everyday, I finally realized it was calculating my wrist/hand movement while driving. It became too much for me to take it off to drive and remember to put it back on, so I stopped wearing it all together! It can easily fall off of your wrist during your normal daily routine. It is far too expensive just to loose! I was looking for it to challenge me, it did nothing of the sort! I challenge the manufacturer to make one that actually calculates steps not wrist movements!
customer_reviews.author: DFL

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, well-thought out product.
customer_reviews.text: I wear this 23.5 hours per day. I give the battery a few "bars" of charge every day when I jump in the shower. That's enough. Very comfortable, even at night whilst sleeping. You'll forget you're wearing it. The auto-on clock feature (when you look at your wrist as if you had a watch on, the clock automatically appears to for 5 seconds) and the vibrating alarm clock (doesn't wake the wife) are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Tim in Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Good Device, insecure band
customer_reviews.text: I like the "fitbit" per se and think the software is cool but I have one complaint, a big one. Usually I would compliment the comfort of this device but the comfort comes with a problem. You do not even know it is on your wrist but this is problem if the "fitbit" band disengages and the device silently drops off your wrist. It is just a matter time before I lose the device because of this failure. In the past week that I have worn the "fitbit" it has come off at least 4 times even though I have paid attention to buckling the band.
customer_reviews.author: JungleLawyer

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: The rubber by the face of the Fitbit is bubbling up from the band. It has gotten progressively worse over the last 2 weeks, with I believe, no way to repair it to an acceptable condition. I am a 60 yr old responsible, cautious individual. This Fitbit has not been by heat, water, or abused. There is no reason this should be happening, other than poor construction. Fitbit- What are you willing to do to make this consumer's 9 month old purchase right?
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Promiseing tool, poor quality band.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas. This is the end of April. [Edit: Issues #2 and #3 seem to be fixed thanks to the information from fitbit in response. Will edit again when I send them the info on issue #1.] Why I don't like this: 1.) About a month ago the cover started peeling off. It's a know issue on another of their products (now discontinued). 2.) I don't like having to tap or push the button to see the time. 3.) It seems to undervalue sleep and overvalue steps (measured against a pedometer). In other words it doesn't seem accurate. It is such a promising tool. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has some problems
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in January 2015. It worked really well for several months but then I started having problems with it holding a charge for more than a day or two. Another problem was that it kept getting caught and would open and fall off my wrist. Even with all that I pressed on because when it worked it did so well. But last night was the worst - sometime during the night the little pin on the side escaped and when I went to check the time this morning there was nothing to push to display the time. I would like to purchase a replacement but I do not want to have the same problems all over agin.
customer_reviews.author: Alice R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not as accurate as they claim
customer_reviews.text: Not as accurate as they claim no matter how much you adjust your stride length. Also it is not as hypo allergenic as they and will irritate some peoples skin if you are disposed to latex allergies. No technical support from this company unless you don't mind waiting a a week to get a reply on a question, you can try a blog, but sometimes the advice was incorrect. The sleep tracker is very nice and helpful to understand how much sleep you are getting. Nice software. Just a recommendation, you most likely need to replace it two or three times before you one that works right, so be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Fred is not dead

customer_reviews.title: The band peeled away after a month.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as a gift. She really liked it. However the band fell apart after only a month or so. It wasn't from abuse, the band just started peeling away from the plastic watch. Since you cannot replace the band on this model, it's now useless. EDIT: Fitbit support does in fact warranty the band and will send a replacement if something happens to it within the year!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Greer

customer_reviews.title: The charge is great, HOWEVER be aware that the band might and ...
customer_reviews.text: The charge is great, HOWEVER be aware that the band might and in my case has started to come apart. I can't return it to Amazon for a replacement. I can only return it to the Seller which is a real pain and dish out more money for shipping. I can see in two or three years the band coming apart, but not after 6 months of use. The charge should be the same as the first model where the band can be changed. Not happy with this and the process of having to return it to the Seller unless I just buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Landis

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor design.
customer_reviews.text: While I LOVE this tracker, and everything it does, it's a piece of junk. I originally ordered my first one in January. By May, I was contacting FitBit (who is WONDERFUL with support), and they sent me a replacement Charge because the band was starting to lift and come off. Now, in August, my replacement Charge is falling apart worse than the original, and I am awaiting my second replacement to arrive. According to the customer service rep I talked to, they are working on improving the design, so I guess we will see if I make it past the 3 month mark with the new one, and judge from there.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Technology But Poor Band Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to remind me to MOVE throughout the day. Great app and website for tracking trends. I have 2 problems with this product, though; the measurements for the size small were way off and it had to be returned but could not be exchanged. After a few months the rubber started to peel away from the Fitbit itself. Fitbit was kind enough to replace it with a new product after telling them what happened and sending them pictures. Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Spotted Mamma

customer_reviews.title: I did love the size and easy read outs
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble with the Fitbit Charge. It will not hold a charge and has to be charged sometimes twice a day. It was hard to set up on my phone and have yet to be able to sync it with our laptop. I did love the size and easy read outs. Contacted Fitbit and they are sending the Alta to replace this item. Don't waste your money on this one for sure. Hope the Alta works better.
customer_reviews.author: BJH IN MT

customer_reviews.title: Great little Gadget
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little gadget. Two things were of interest to me. 1. Logging my steps, which any pedometer could do for a lot less money and 2. Logging my sleep. The big difference is syncing and using with my IPad and IPhone. It's a lot of fun and helps motivate me me to walk those extra steps. I also utilize the Friends challenge and have a little healthy competition going on. There are many settings to choose from which is great for customizing. I set mine to vibrate at 10,000 steps and also get caller ID on my Fitbit Charge. Only problem I had was syncing Bluetooth for caller ID but searched out the solution and was successful.
customer_reviews.author: Mutualfun

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected...doesn't accurately track active minutes. Customer service wasn't all that helpful when I emailed them. I wish I'd have spent less and just bought a fitbit zip. Update: Charge doesn't seem to be holding a reliable battery charge. Customer service was more helpful but I'm wearing a regular watch more than my Charge at this point since it's either on the charger or completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: tfletcher

customer_reviews.title: I like the tracker, but plastic falling off after 9 months of wear
customer_reviews.text: I really like the functionality of the Fitbit Activity tracker. I wear mine daily and have for 9 months. I am careful to take it off whenever I'm around water, etc. The only bummer about this tracker is that it is now literally falling apart. The plastic is coming off of the sides and top. At some point soon I won't be able to wear it, which is disappointing since I only bought it 9 months ago. For the price, the product should be able to withstand more than a year of use. Going forward, I will probably look to buy a tracker that's more durable for daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher William George

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item a few months ago (March 2016). I love it and while it was working nicely at first it now barely holds a charge. This is very disappointing to me as the item is less then 6 months old. I have charged this item over night only to wake up the next morning to it only being half charged. It only comes with a plug to charge it, no box or anything to put the plug into. While this item has it's perks, it's very disappointing with the battery life as I lose steps since I have to keep charging it. My Fitbit will only give me about a 1/2 day of battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: My friend who goes every where with me and even sleeps with me.
customer_reviews.text: Mine was not charging correctly, these great guys are sending a replacement. I think I've been on the Fitbit bandwagon since about 2012. I've had the clip and the one and now the charge and the one. They're interchangeable for different needs. You can have two on your account. ( don't wear both at the same time) I love it and it gets me off my lazy old butt. The software is great and it interacts with my lose it program. I've dropped about thirty pounds over the last eight months and this has been a great help. Thank you Fitbit and keep up the great customer relations.
customer_reviews.author: flc

customer_reviews.title: I don't so much trust the sleep monitor but otherwise it's pretty cool. Then I hit the one year mark
customer_reviews.text: I have had a blast keeping up with my steps throughout the year. I don't so much trust the sleep monitor but otherwise it's pretty cool. Then I hit the one year mark. With no hard wear or tear, the seams around the unit itself started peeling away. In speaking with many others that own my model and searching on line, many are complaining about the same thing. When addressing this issue with Fitbit, they have totally blown everyone off. Amazon should really think about addressing this issue and customer service with the company.
customer_reviews.author: Shoeprints

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Wrist Band Needs Re-Design
customer_reviews.text: Good product. If I had it to do over again I'd probably get the heart monitor option. Activity monitoring works well. Sleep monitoring is a bit "iffy" in my experience but since I'm asleep it may be right! Biggest grumble is that I have to use the loosest setting on the wrist band and my wrist isn't that big. I don't think a person with a really large wrist could wear it. Plus if you are very active, it could snag on something and pop off. I think the new ones have more traditional wrist bands which is a big improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Wade S. Schofield

customer_reviews.title: Fell Off My Wrist and is Lost
customer_reviews.text: I had my Fitbit Charge for about a week before it dropped off of my wrist without my noticing it, and now it is gone. The catch had come loose several times before I lost it when I accidentally bumped the inside of my wrist against things. I should have realized that that meant that the catch was going to make me lose the Fitbit eventually. It didn't take long. I am entirely certain that I was fastening the catch properly. It was easy to tell when it was fastened. The design of the catch just doesn't hold very well. A hundred dollars plus down the drain due to a "clever" catch that doesn't work reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Luther

customer_reviews.title: I had problems with accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I moved up to this model after using a Fitbit One for almost a year. I was very disappointed with the accuracy of the Charge. It is not as accurate as the One which I have gauged with my car AND other apps like MapMyWalk. Like the One, it displays time, steps, mileage, stairs climbed and calories burned. I do like that feature. I contacted the Fitbit forum with my concern about accuracy. I received no response from them but lots of other customers had similar complaints. One day I wore both of my Fitbits. There was a 1500 step difference between the two. I have gone back to using the One.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Grey

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my Fitbit Charge. It provides all of the information and motivation that I need. The one that I recently purchased is a replacement for my original, which was two years old before it began to fail. Setup of the new one, and the preservation of my old data, required a call to Fitbit customer support. That turned out to be pretty quick and painless. It's good to have a fully-functioning Fitbit again. A minor complaint is that the color of the wristband as it appears on the webpage is not the same as it appears in reality. I was expecting a darker blue/grey and it's a shade lighter. Hardly a deal-breaker, though.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Love my FitBit
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this gadget! Got one for the wife and we have a little friendly competition on who is the "Big Stepper". Now the kids want one as well. The companion software is nice as well. I enjoy the real time stats and long-term trend charting. The only thing that is in anyway inconvenient is that it isn't water proof, but you can use that time for charging. One feature that I thought initially was a throw away is the alarm function. I use the alarm all the time now and it wakes me up better than any bed side clock.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Duke

customer_reviews.title: Terrible accuracy. Counts steps when just moving my arm ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible accuracy. Counts steps when just moving my arm to adjust my monitor or when I reach for something on my desk. It doesn't matter what setting you use, dominant or non-non-dominant arm. Even logging the same walk that I tracked via GPS manullay entered different times and steps. This product is not accurate at all. I will be returning mine via Amazon tonight. FYI - Fitbit's customer service told me to enter the data manually for a more accurate measurement. Duh! What's the point of your device then. I can enter data manually in one of a thousand software products on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good product but the strap does not last too long.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is a great product but it does not last too long because the strap comes apart easily. After one year of daily wearing this, the straps came apart and the engine fell off. Had to use glue to glue it back and then would always adjust it. Also, it is not water resistance, and then slowly the holes in the strap starts enlarge and become an issue. Also, the is not changeable or replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Strong Dude

customer_reviews.title: Not a durable product
customer_reviews.text: I was jazzed about it at first, but I have found that the device and it's parts do not hold up. The face is coming apart from the wristband and the wristband is coming apart. Something made to be worn pretty much around the clock should be more durable. ADDENDUM: I upped the rating to four stars because the product and its software, other than the band, are good, and the customer service is excellent. I will see what happens with the replacement and will monitor the band and its attachment to the unit.
customer_reviews.author: VickiC

customer_reviews.title: Defective battery
customer_reviews.text: Update: Battery doesn't seem to last much more than 24hrs. We've charged it overnight, made sure everything is off for it (no silent alarms, caller ID or anything).....will be contacting Amazon to see what we can do. Bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. He loves it. I loved the fact that it counts flights of stairs. He wanted one that also told time, that's another reason why we went with the charge for him. It really makes you want to get your steps in
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this to be a great product so badly
customer_reviews.text: The actualy fitbit works well, but there are some significant syncing problems. The first one was replaced by Amazon, and now the second one has the same problem. Fitbit tech support keeps telling me to do the same stuf over and over again, face it, the sync doesn't work. I wanted this to be a great product so badly, alas, it is not Works great--when it works. I'm off to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love it! It allows you to track what you ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It allows you to track what you want to track. For example you can track work outs, water intake, weight, calories, sleep, etc. Right now I am more interested in the calorie intake/output and weight goals so have not started to track water consumption. I have found that most foods are available to track but you have the option of putting in a new food for items that are homemade that don't have an equivalent already. The device itself it lightweight and I don't usually notice it until I am doing dishes or about to take a shower when I need to take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Brianne Kett

customer_reviews.title: REALLY disappointing because I enjoyed using it - but if they break this easily ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought TWO of these - one for my sister and one for myself. The button on the side - used to push the watch on and off - has fallen off of both of them within three months. REALLY disappointing because I enjoyed using it - but if they break this easily they are hardly worth what I paid for them. Though the box says the Fitbit has a warranty I cannot return through Amazon. FRUSTRATED - and annyed because I really enjoyed using it both as a tracker and a watch, and now I feel like it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: kaycee e.

customer_reviews.title: Lost 15 pounds just by tracking my activity!
customer_reviews.text: I wear my Fitbit every minute of every day and it has helped me to be more aware of my (lack of) activity. Since purchasing this in December 2014, I have lost 15 pounds just by tracking my activity and logging my food consumption. I log every single thing I eat and the Fitbit app on my phone makes it so convenient to do - and, I can find the nutritional info of any food (store bought, restaurants, etc) on the app or website so I know my calorie intake is as correct as it can get. Very comfortable band, and the battery life is quote long - I charge mine only once per week.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: This product is junk. The battery died in less ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. The battery died in less than a week of using it and could not be recharged. Fitbit sent me a refurbished unit as a replacement even though I had this less than a week. The refurbished unit fell apart, the silicone on the wristband came off. Fitbit sent me two other replacements, both batteries died and could not be recharged. I have had the Fitbit one and never had a problem. I ultimately downgraded to the Fitbit flex and haven't had a problem. Also, the price has dropped dramatically on this product which leads me to believe that Fitbit knows there is a problem and is trying to sell them off.
customer_reviews.author: alimak

customer_reviews.title: Defective bracelet on this device.
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit charge has a problem in that the clasp will not stay closed while on your wrist. Just putting your hand into your pocket will unlatch it causing it to fall off (you won't even feel it fall off), This had happened to me on 2 occasions, luckily it was turned in and I was able to retrieve it. For another $5:00 you can get a small belt device to keep it secure on your wrist. This is a major fault and must be corrected. I would suggest that Amazon remove this device until this faulf is corrected.

product_meta.title: Fitbit Charge Wireless Activity Wristband, Black, Small
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Size:SmallEnergize your day with the Fitbit Charge Wireless Activity + Sleep Wristband. This fitness watch monitors sleep and tracks steps taken, distance traveled, floors climbed, and calories consumed and burned. Sync your stats wirelessly to your smartphone or computer from up to 20ft away and view your progress in easy-to-read charts and graphs. See daily stats, time of day, day of the week, and exercise mode on the OLED display, as well as who's calling you with the synced caller ID feature. Get the most out of your R. E. M. cycle with the sleep monitor to see just how long and how well you're sleeping throughout the night. The unremitting battery lasts 7-10 days, while this tough timepiece is splash and rain-proof to keep you crushing your goals, even in inclement weather.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
•Tracks 7 days of detailed motion data – minute by minute. •Tracks daily totals for past 30 days •Stores heart rate data at 1 second intervals during exercise tracking and at 5 second intervals all other times

BUYING GUIDE
Move it up: Since blood increases further up your arm, wear your tracker higher on your wrist to improve the heart rate signal during workouts. Start by moving the device up to three finger widths above your wrist bone, then experiment with slightly lower placement. Keep it secure: The less your tracker moves during exercise, the more chance you have of maintaining a heart rate signal throughout the activity. Do not wear the band too tightly, as this can restrict blood flow and goes against our wear and care guidelines. Hold steady for ten seconds: High intensity exercises or activities that cause you to keep your wrist bent (like push-ups) or move your arms vigorously (like dance) may interfere with heart rate signals. If you stop seeing a signal during these types of activities, hold your wrist steady for ten seconds during breaks to get your reading.
